revision.text:
{{Infobox scholar |name = Howard Curtis Richards |image = File:Professor Howard C. Richards.png |caption = |birth_date ={{birth date and age|mf=yes|1938|6|10}} |birth_place = [[Pasadena, California|Pasadena]], [[California]] United States |death_date = |death_place = |alma_mater = [[University of California, Santa Barbara]] | thesis_title = Distributive Justice | thesis_url = http://philpapers.org/rec/RICDJ | thesis_year = 1974 | influences = {{ublist|[[Paulo Freire]]|[[Rom Harré]]|[[Gandhi]]}} |major_works = {{ublist|class=nowrap |Letters from Quebec |Understanding the Global Economy |Dilemmas of Social Democracies |The Evaluation of Cultural Action |Gandhi and the Future of Economics |Re-thinking the Economy |Unbounded Organization}} |spouse = Caroline Higgins }}
'''Howard Richards''' (born June 10, 1938) is a [[philosophy|philosopher]] of [[Social Science]] who works with the concepts of ''basic cultural structures''<ref group="nb">Richards [http://www.howardri.org/Let60.html What the World Needs Now]. Cultural action to transform the basic structures of the modern world is a general concept that unites most of Richards' writing - see: Richards (2014): [http://unboundedorganization.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/08/Chapter-One-Rosario.pdf Unbounded Organization] p. 1 and 8. ''Methods for Transforming the Structures of the Modern World'' is the subtitle of Vol.II of {{harvnb|Richards|1994}} ''Letters from Quebec''.</ref> and ''constitutive rules''.<ref group="nb"> Constitutive rule, a key concept rooted in the work of [[John Searle]] and [[Charles Taylor (philosopher)|Charles Taylor]] and in Richards' Oxford tutor [[Rom Harré]]'s rules-oriented approach to the explanation of social behavior. One can find a good description of what Prof Richards understands by ''Constitutive Rules'' in his 2010 speech at the [[University of South Africa]] (UNISA) [http://howardrichards.org/peace4us/humanizing-methodologies-in-transformation/ Humanizing Methodologies in Transformation].</ref> He holds the title of Research Professor of Philosophy at [[Earlham College]], a [[Liberal arts colleges in the United States|liberal arts college]] in [[Richmond, Indiana]], United States, the Quaker School where he taught for thirty years. He officially retired from Earlham College, together with his wife Caroline Higgins in 2007, but retained the title of Research Professor of Philosophy. He has a PhD in Philosophy from the [[University of California, Santa Barbara]],<ref>{{harvnb|Richards|1974}} (Santa Barbara PhD Dissertation).</ref> a [[Juris Doctor]] (J.D.) from the [[Stanford Law School]], an Advanced Certificate in Education (ACE) from [[Oxford University]] (UK) and a PhD in Educational Planning <ref>With a first field in Curriculum Planning and a second field in [[Applied Psychology]] and [[Moral Education]] with a doctoral thesis on the Chilean PPH (Parents and Children) Project, published as "''The Evaluation of Cultural Action''" ({{harvnb|Richards|1984}}).</ref> from the [[Ontario Institute for Studies in Education]] (OISE), [[University of Toronto]], Canada. He now teaches at the [[University of Santiago, Chile]],<ref>On the doctoral program in [[Management Science]] and the undergraduate program in Ingeneria Comercial (Economics).</ref> and has ongoing roles at the [[University of South Africa]] (UNISA) <ref> [http://rur.pascalobservatory.org/sites/default/files/dst_nrf_sarchi_development_education_trajectory_2013_v21_pascal.pdf Development Education] p.3 ; [http://www.unisa.ac.za/default.asp?Cmd=ViewContent&ContentID=22551 School of Human Sciences].</ref> and the [[University of Cape Town]]'s Graduate School of Business program. He is founder of the Peace and Global Studies Program<ref group="nb">The name of the Program has varied over the years from Peace Studies to Peace and Conflict Studies and then, continuing until now, Peace and Global Studies.</ref> and co-founder of the Business and Nonprofit Management Program at Earlham.<ref>[http://pascalobservatory.org/users/howard-richards Howard Richards] profile.</ref>
==Early life== Howard Richards was born in [[Pasadena, California|Pasadena]]. [[California]], United States, the eldest child of Kenneth F. Richards, a truck mechanic, originally from [[Connecticut]], and his wife Donna.<ref group="nb">(McCune)</ref> It was his mother's intellectual interest in philosophers such as [[Henri Bergson]] which prompted the family to break its ties with [[mormon]]ism. His paternal grandparents fell into unemployment in Connecticut during the [[Great Depression]] and moved to Pasadena in 1932. It was his uncle Jack from his mother's side, who died during [[World War II]],<ref>p 257 in [https://books.google.com/books?id=9Kw5vLbYq-4C&pg=PA257&lpg=PA257&dq=howard+richards+uncle+Jack&source=bl&ots=b12zT_qO9A&sig=1WNK9Bn5ot8Sft8kvdofeKXL80&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CCEQ6AEwAGoVChMIx8Kol5GyxwIVCTnbCh3KMgfV#v=onepage&q=howard%20richards%20uncle%20Jack&f=false Understanding the Global Economy] and under "The Holocaust" in [http://www.howardri.org/logicalpeaceplan.html Richards], 2002.</ref> and especially his mother who fostered his early intellectual interest.<ref>see eg [http://lists.topica.com/lists/CERJ/read/message.html?sort=d&mid=1721114650&start=0 TOPICA]</ref>
==Academic background== After graduating from [[Redlands High School]], CA, in June 1956, Richards enrolled in the same year as a Philosophy undergraduate at [[Yale University|Yale]]. Being a top student, he was allowed to skip one year of the normal three year Major in Philosophy course. Afterwards he was admitted to [[Stanford Law School]] in 1958, graduating with a Juris Doctor ([[Juris Doctor|J.D.]]) degree in 1961. Later in that year he enrolled in graduate school at the [[University of California Santa Barbara]], earning an M.A. in Philosophy there in 1964 with a thesis on [[Jean-Paul Sartre]].<ref>{{harvnb|Richards|1963}} (MA Philosophy Thesis).</ref> Simultaneously he worked at the [[Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions]] think tank where he contributed several articles to the in-house Center Magazine.<ref>a.o. an article entitled "A normative Economics" - see [http://www.howardri.org/Bib.html Richards Bibliography] Articles.</ref> In 1965 he left for Chile, where they ultimately would settle in the town of [[Limache]]. Soon after their arrival, Howard took up the post of Dean of Studies at the [[Santiago College]], (a college in Chile is a secondary school). While in [[Santiago]], Howard joined the Chilean Ministry of Education as an advisor to President [[Eduardo Frei Montalva|Eduardo Frei]]'s Educational Reform, working on a Secondary Curriculum influenced by the ideas of the Brazilian Educator [[Paulo Freire]]<ref>CPEIP-MINEDUC - Centro de Perfeccionamiento, Experimentación e Investigaciones Pedagógicas. Ministerio de la Educación.</ref> In late 1970 Richards and his family left for the UK where Richards enrolled for an Advanced Certificate in Education (ACE) at [[Oxford University]], simultaneously doing one on one tutorials and attending seminars by the philosophers [[Rom Harré]] and [[A. J. Ayer]].<ref>See eg [https://books.google.com/books?id=c14UNW298sAC&pg=PA438&lpg=PA438&dq=howard+richards+rom+harre&source=bl&ots=pmbiSC7QsD&sig=fjosYk8zOkT4JROztTd4-cl2LYU&hl=es&sa=X&ei=9qqiVabWHa3d7QacvYOADA&ved=0CCQQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=howard%20richards%20rom%20harre&f=false Harré], who had a strong influence on Richards' thinking.</ref> He graduated with an honors thesis on [[Jean Piaget|Piaget]].<ref>"''The Concept of Causality in the Light of Piaget's Research on the Scientific Thinking of Children''" Thesis, Oxford University, 1973. Translated as Richards, 1974 ''El Desarollo Intelectual del Niño'' (see eg: [http://unesdoc.unesco.org/images/0002/000281/028108eo.pdf Prospects UNESCO 1977] Vol. VII No. 4. p 557).</ref> Back in Chile in 1972, now under president [[Salvador Allende]], he continued to work with Freire's ideas at CIDE (Centro de Investigación y Desarrollo de la Educación - Educational Research and Development Center) where he founded the Parents and Children Program (Programa Padres e Hijos - PHH), a Community Development combined with a Parent Education program.<ref name="RichardsEs">{{harvnb|Richards|1982}} Spanish</ref><ref name="RichardsEn">{{harvnb|Richards|1984}} English</ref><ref>[http://files.eric.ed.gov/fulltext/ED376920.pdf Howard Richards and Loren Pierce], 1993 "Cooperative, Community-based Evaluation of Preschool Programs". UNESCO and the Netherlands National Commission for UNESCO. pp 303-323.</ref><ref>McKee, Neill. "Teaching Parents Teaching Children." The IDRC Reports (Ottawa) 10, no. 3 (Oct. 1981): 16-17.</ref>
Richards and his family left Chile in 1974, after [[Pinochet]]'s 1973 [[1973 Chilean coup d'état|coup d'état]], but not before having helped friends and colleagues escape Pinochet's [[Dirección de Inteligencia Nacional|DINA]] police.<ref>As described in [http://www.biblio.com/sweet-country-by-richards-caroline/work/378047 Sweet Country], a book authored by Howard's wife Caroline and which was later (1987) turned into a [https://www.nytimes.com/1987/01/23/movies/film-sweet-country.html film of the same name] (re: ''[[Sweet Country (1987 film)|Sweet Country]]'') by the Greek director [[Michael Cacoyannis]].</ref> The philosophy curriculum Richards had helped develop was repealed shortly after the coup, but was adopted in several other Latin American countries. In September 1974 Richards and his family returned to the USA where he started work at [[Earlham College]] in [[Richmond, Indiana|Richmond]], [[Indiana]]. Later that year he successfully defended his doctoral thesis in Philosophy at the [[University of California Santa Barbara]], having done the preparatory work when still in Chile.<ref>{{harvnb|Richards|1974}} ''Distributive Justice'' Doctoral Thesis.</ref> While based in Richmond, he attended the [[Lawrence Kohlberg]] Summer School on Moral Education at [[Harvard University]]. Richards became a professor at Earlham College and was the founding director of its [http://www.earlham.edu/peace-and-global-studies/the-program/ Peace and Global Studies] program until 1989 and part-time Director until 2004. Between 1981 and 1985, Richards combined commitments in Richmond with those at [http://www.oise.utoronto.ca/oise/Home/ OISE, Toronto], with the occasional stay in [[Quebec]] where their daughters were studying at a French-speaking school, he enrolled in another PhD program in Education, with a first field in curriculum planning and a second field in [[applied psychology]] and moral education, at the [[University of Toronto]]'s Institute for Studies in Education (UT/OISE), which he successfully completed with a doctoral thesis based on the Chilean PPH program.<ref>This OISE thesis was published as {{harvnb|Richards|1982}} and translated into English as {{harvnb|Richards|1984}}.</ref><ref name= "Beatrice">{{cite book|url= http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0738059385900124|title= The Evaluation of Cultural Action|first=Beatrice|last=Avalos|year=1985|publisher= Int. Jnl. Educational Development, Vol. 5. No. 3|pages=235–239 - review}}</ref> He also became an active [http://www.understandingeconomy.org/assets/PDF/Evaluating_action_%20for_systemic_transformation.pdf contributor] to the OISE-based [https://books.google.com/books?id=9Kw5vLbYq-4C&pg=RA1-PA208&lpg=RA1-PA208&dq=The+Transformative+Learning+Centre+Howard+Richards&source=bl&ots=b12xMUpK9B&sig=ocU5PXvctShp1epcRg9maeKzAYY&hl=es&sa=X&ved=0CCEQ6AEwAGoVChMIn8apleLhxgIVqwrbCh26ZQsK#v=onepage&q=The%20Transformative%20Learning%20Centre%20Howard%20Richards&f=false active think-tank] about the new economic paradigm known as [http://tlc.oise.utoronto.ca/About.html The Transformative Learning Centre] (TLC).
==Social engagement, research and teaching== At [[Stanford Law School]] (1958–61) he co-founded the Stanford Political Union's Socialist Caucus,<ref>see eg [http://stanforddailyarchive.com/cgi-bin/stanford?a=d&d=stanford19601020-01.2.16&e=-------en-20--1--txt-txIN------- The Stanford Daily] Volume 138, Issue 20, 20 October 1960, p 2.</ref> became involved in the [[Peace Movement]] and began volunteer work for farm labor causes.<ref name= "Journal Labor">{{cite book|url=http://scholarship.law.upenn.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1232&context=jbl|title=Law, Lawyers and Labor|first=Jennifer|last=Gordon|year=2005|publisher=University PA.|page=13. n.38}}</ref> He co-founded, with Stanford radical books seller Roy Kepler, Ira Sandperl and others, the Peninsula Peace Center, effectively running it for a while.<ref name="Radical Chapters">{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=VIqiAgAAQBAJ&pg=PA187&lpg=PA187&dq=howard+richards+Utopian+Papers&source=bl&ots=q6q2gd7K5h&sig=72LYqjqAsyysm7YpdLlLRShohEg&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CCEQ6AEwAGoVChMIneO7loXgxgIVhQjbCh1wEwRl#v=onepage&q=howard%20richards%20Utopian%20Papers&f=false |title=Radical Chapters |first=Michael |last=Doyle |year=2014 |publisher=Syracuse University Press |page=187 |isbn=9780815650836}}</ref> He was also editor and author of a modest journal called ''Utopian Papers''.<ref name="Radical Chapters" /> After graduation from law school (1961), he joined the Santa Barbara, California [[Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions]] headed by [[Robert Hutchins]] to whom he became a personal assistant,<ref>[http://www.oac.cdlib.org/findaid/ark:/13030/ft538nb1fk/dsc/ Online Archive of California] Series 3. Howard Richards, 1955-1965</ref> and became the first volunteer attorney for [[Cesar Chavez]]' [http://www.oac.cdlib.org/findaid/ark:/13030/ft538nb1fk/dsc/ Farm Workers Association] when he started organizing the FWA in [https://books.google.com/books?id=9Kw5vLbYq-4C&pg=RA1-PR2&lpg=RA1-PR2&dq=howard+richards+Cesar+Chavez+delano&source=bl&ots=b12xNTpGhv&sig=rYKihTqhH4LD2jKoCWYCLlLToSo&hl=es&sa=X&ved=0CCsQ6AEwAWoVChMIyKnAnbDkxgIV5KzbCh3_MANA#v=onepage&q=howard%20richards%20Cesar%20Chavez%20delano&f=false Delano], California.<ref>Eg [https://books.google.com/books?id=c14UNW298sAC&pg=PA433&lpg=PA433&dq=attorney+howard+richards+Cesar+Chavez+in+Delano&source=bl&ots=pmbjLG7QqB&sig=a27f0PP0AQ7FBFzokmCSLZwVqkA&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0CC4Q6AEwAmoVChMIwu_jq4jgxgIVATrbCh3_YQEr#v=onepage&q=attorney%20howard%20richards%20Cesar%20Chavez%20in%20Delano&f=false Dilemmas of Social Democracies] and [http://www.oac.cdlib.org/findaid/ark:/13030/ft538nb1fk/dsc/ Online Archive of California]</ref> He worked as evaluator of cultural change projects in Costa Rica, Ecuador, Bolivia and Chile <ref>see eg: [http://pascalobservatory.org/users/howard-richards Richards PASCAL profile].</ref> He also did evaluative work on economic institutions (''Economía Solidaria'') in Argentina.<ref>Richards, H. (2015) [http://guadaloupe.org/guadalupe/index2.php?option=content&do_pdf=1&id=9El Desarrollo Local Como Respuesta a los Desafíos de la Globalización] (Local Development: a response to the challenges of Globalization) Rosario, Argentina. / Richards, H. (2014) [http://www.economiasolidaria.org/documentos/hacia_un_marco_juridico_para_la_economia_solidaria Hacia un Marco Jurídico para la Economía Solidaria] (Towards a legal framework for the Economy of Solidarity).</ref> Economic theory and Community Development together with Public Employment Programs are his more recent research areas.<ref>[http://www.internationalpeaceandconflict.org/profile/HowardRichards892#.VauC_jH6H9k Peace & Collaborative Development Network] PCDN (HR personal info).</ref>
He is on the Advisory Board of [[Human Dignity and Humiliation Studies]] (HumanDHS), a global transdisciplinary fellowship of concerned academics and practitioners who wish to promote [[dignity]] and transcend [[humiliation]].<ref>HumanDHS [http://www.humiliationstudies.org/research/economicsteam.php Global Economics Team]; HumanDHS [http://www.humiliationstudies.org/whoweare/annualmeeting/21.php Annual Meeting] 2013, South Africa.</ref> Richards' principal teaching experience stretches from 1974 to 2007 as Professor of Philosophy and Education on the Peace and Global Studies Program (PAGS) at [[Earlham College]].<ref>See: PAGS [http://www.earlham.edu/media/894497/Swanger,%20Ch.%2030.pdf College Curriculum].</ref> When no longer at Earlham, he taught short courses in different international locations.<ref>[[University of Buenos Aires]]: Negotiation and Change; [http://www.isparm.edu.ar/ Montoya Institute], Posadas, Argentina: Methodology of Peace; [https://www.transcend.org/tpu/ Transcend Peace University], Cluj, Romania: Peace Business; [https://www.facebook.com/pages/Instituto-de-Pastoral-y-Evangelizaci%C3%B3n-Arquidi%C3%B3cesis-de-Los-Angeles/485342990466 ''Instituto Pastoral''] (Pastoral Institute), LA Diocese, California: Social Sciences, as well as single classes, a.o. at [http://www.uchile.cl/english University of Chile], [http://www.xavier.edu/about/ Xavier University], [http://www.uahurtado.cl/ Universidad Alberto Hurtado] (Chile), [[University of California, San Diego]], and other places. (see eg: [http://lists.topica.com/lists/CERJ/read/message.html?sort=d&mid=1720435092 Topica.com])</ref> Starting in 2009 he became a distinguished fellow of the [http://pascalobservatory.org/member/university-south-africa-unisa South African Research Chairs Initiative] in Development Education ([http://www.unisa.ac.za/contents/research_planning/docs/SARChI_Chair_Development_hoppers.pdf SARChI]) based at the [[University of South Africa]] (UNISA) [[Pretoria]], and then a collaborator at the [[Johannesburg]]-based [http://www.seriti.org.za/ Seriti Institute] with Dr. [http://rur.pascalobservatory.org/pascalnow/blogentry/pascal-co-directors-visit-seriti-institute-joburg Gavin Andersson]. In South Africa, too, he teaches in the Executive MBA Program at the [[University of Cape Town]].<ref>[http://pascalobservatory.org/pascalnow/pascal-activities/news/uct-affirms-transformative-efforts-sarchi-chair MBA Programme].</ref> He is also co-chair of the Chilean group [http://www.repensar.cl Repensar Ia Economía] (Re-thinking the Economy).<ref>[http://repensar.cl/howard-richards/ REPENSAR] and [http://www.uvirtual.net/spuv/node/154 UNIVERSITAS NUEVA CIVILIZACIÓN] (New Civilization University) Santiago, Chile.</ref>
==Law practice== Richards was the first volunteer attorney for [[Cesar Chavez]]'s [[United Farm Workers of America]], protecting the union's funds against grower lawsuits.<ref name="Journal Labor"/> In 1983 he became member of the American Bankruptcy Institute.{{citation needed|date=September 2018}} In 1989 he started practicing law in Santa Barbara, joining the [http://www.lafsbc.org/ Legal Aid Foundation] and specializing in bankruptcy,<ref>see [http://www.nacba.org/ National Association of Consumer Bankruptcy Attorneys](NACBA).</ref> In 1990 he also was a voluntary attorney at the [http://www.lafla.org/ Los Angeles Free Clinic],<ref>[https://www.justia.com/lawyers/california/goleta?page=2 Justicia] members.</ref> a practice he wound up in 2004, when he moved back to [[Limache]], Chile.
==Major works and ideas== * In his first major work, ''The Evaluation of Cultural Action'' (1984),<ref name="RichardsEs"/><ref name="RichardsEn"/> Richards ''"unveils throughout the text the rationale for using an 'illuminative' approach (Parlett and Hamilton, 1974) rather than a conventional 'systems' assessment"''.<ref name="Beatrice"/> The long dialogue with a "reasonable social scientist" gravitates around how to evaluate education and community development efforts inspired by the Brazilian adult educationist [[Paulo Freire]]'s philosophy, combined with an empirical study of one such effort, namely PPH (Parents and Children Program) that flourished among peasants in the south of Chile in the 1970s and 1980s. * Richards' two-volume ''Letters from Quebec: a Philosophy for Peace and Justice'' (1994) <ref>{{harvnb|Richards|1994}}, Bloomberg books, also published by [http://www.gamutbooks.org/cf71y_letters-from-quebec-a-philosophy-for-peace-and-justice-pdf.pdf International Scholars Press, 1996]. ''Letters from Quebec Vol 1 & 2'' can be read online on [https://www.scribd.com/doc/184024951/Howard-Richards-Letters-From-Quebec-vols-1-2-pdf#scribd Scribd].</ref> aspires to be both literary entertainment and a history of [[rationality]] in western culture and philosophy, illuminating the possibilities for transformative and humanistic action. The subtitle of volume Two of ''Letters from Quebec'' is 'Methods for Transforming the Structures of the Modern World'. Taking leads from [[Paulo Freire]] and [[Antonio Gramsci]], the philosopher is seen - borrowing a phrase from [[Paulo Freire]] - as a 'cultural activist' who invents rationalities. * Building on the premise that standards of [[rationality]] are historically [[social construct|constructed]] social norms, he went on, in ''Understanding the Global Economy'' (2004),<ref>{{harvnb|Richards|2004}} (Peace Education Books) was originally published by [https://books.google.com/books/about/Understanding_the_global_economy.html?id=8yQPAQAAMAAJ&redir_esc=y Maadhyam] in 2000.</ref> to argue that causal explanations in economics invariably rely, as premises, on cultural norms, and particularly on constitutive rules <ref>"Constitutive rules constitute (and also regulate) an activity the existence of which is logically dependent on the rules." [http://howardrichards.org/peace4us/humanizing-methodologies-in-transformation/ Richards, 2010].</ref> Richards proposes to understand institutions by following out the consequences of the rules that organize them. ''Understanding the Global Economy'' reviews the principal schools of economic thought with respect to the causal explanations they offer of the phenomena of today's global economy.<ref>[[Betty Reardon]], ([http://www.howardri.org/reardon.html foreword]).</ref> * ''The Dilemmas of Social Democracies: Overcoming Obstacles to a More Just World'' (2008)<ref>{{harvnb|Richards|Swanger|2008}}</ref> co-authored with Joanna Swanger, applies the philosophical ideas of Richards' earlier works, particularly a concept of basic cultural structure,<ref>Basic cultural structure: see eg Richards [http://www.howardri.org/Let60.html What the World Needs Now].</ref> - where 'basic' identifies those cultural structures that govern the satisfaction of the [[basic needs]] of life - to historical case studies of Spain, Sweden, Austria, South Africa, Indonesia, Venezuela, and the World Bank. The upshot is that [[social democracy]] is not feasible with the framework provided by the [https://books.google.com/books?id=9Kw5vLbYq-4C&pg=PA209&lpg=PA209&dq=constitutive+rules+richards+howard&source=bl&ots=b12xUSpKeA&sig=u909sw7jg_vICvEW5_ExayXE9gU&hl=es&sa=X&ved=0CC8Q6AEwAmoVChMI1NTNibz4xgIVqZbbCh1ZJQvj#v=onepage&q=constitutive%20rules%20richards%20howard&f=false constitutive rules] of modernity. Social democracy can only become feasible by adopting an approach Richards and another co-author, Gavin Andersson, will later call [http://www.seriti.org.za/index.php/unbounded-organization unbounded organization].<ref>{{harvnb|Andersson|Richards|2012}}.</ref> * ''Gandhi and the Future of Economics'' (2011) <ref>{{harvnb|Richards|Swanger|2011}}</ref> "makes a case for incorporating [[Gandhi]]'s insights into mainstream economics. ''Gandhi and the Future of Economics'' is not meant to be a research study of Gandhian economics. It is rather that kind of felicitous publication that breathes new life into a known theme, and, in doing so, brings out its implications for [[Praxis (process)|praxis]]. It does all this in dialogue with a set of contemporary thinkers and actors from the Indian sub-continent: [[Jawaharlal Nehru]], [[Jayaprakash Narayan]], [[Tariq Ali]], [[Vandana Shiva]], [[Amartya Sen]], [[Arundhati Roy]], [[Manmohan Singh]]." ([http://liveencounters.net/?page_id=6537 Ivo Coelho]). * ''The Nurturing of Time Future'' (2012)<ref>{{harvnb|Richards|2012}}</ref> defines itself as "a short book about everything", addressed to educated people of good will who see the need for paradigmatic change. It proposes a philosophy in the old-fashioned sense of articulating a synthesis of the social and natural sciences that provides an overall framework for deciding what to do. It is a '[[belles lettres]]' exercise written in the style of [[Marcel Proust]].<ref>[http://www.smirkingchimp.com/thread/jane-stillwater/43241/america-losing-its-true-moral-compass Jane Stillwater] (review)</ref> * ''Rethinking Thinking: Modernity's "Other" and the transformation of the University'' (2012)<ref>{{harvnb|Hoppers|Richards|2012}}</ref> co-authored with [http://www.unisa.ac.za/Default.asp?Cmd=ViewContent&ContentID=27341 Catherine Hoppers], further develops a theme found in early works – that modernity has much to learn from pre-modernity. It includes an account of how the constitutive rules of markets presupposed by economics developed in [[Roman Law]]. They are contrasted with indigenous African cultural norms. ''Rethinking'' also argues that bringing modernity's "other" into the curriculum of the university will transform the curriculum, transform research and transform [[community engagement]].<ref>[https://ejournals.library.ualberta.ca/index.php/cpi/article/download/22935/17082 T. Pilay] and [http://www.litnet.co.za/rethinking-thinking-modernitys-other-and-the-transformation-of-the-university/ van der Westhuizen] (reviews).</ref> * Richards' most recent book ''Unbounded Organizing in Community'' (2015),<ref>{{harvnb|Andersson|Richards|2015}}</ref> co-authored with Gavin Andersson of South Africa's [http://www.seriti.org.za/ Seriti Institute], offers a combination of a down to earth, practical guide to doing community organizing inspired by the [[Organization Workshop]]s of [[Clodomir Santos de Morais]], with an elementary introduction to Andersson's theory of [http://www.seriti.org.za/index.php/unbounded-organization unbounded organization]. Emphasis is on practical examples and guidelines for organizers and participants.
==Other books and articles== Richards has also published fourteen other books some in English and some in Spanish, among the latter, Richards, 1987, ''[http://biblio.udb.edu.sv/library/index.php?title=38676&query=@title=Special:GSMSearchPage@process=@field1=encabezamiento@value1=ETICA%20@mode=advanced&recnum=84 Ética y Economía]'' (Ethics and Economics), and González Meyer & Richards (2012) ''Hacia otras Economias. Critica al paradigma dominante'' (Towards other Economies - Critique of the dominant Paradigm).<ref>{{harvnb| González Meyer|Richards|2012}}. See: J.J. Nagata in [http://www.revistaespacios.cl/?cat=181 "Espacios"] Jnl, Nr 2. Vol.1 Dec. 2011. (review).</ref> A list of Richards' other books, articles, conferences and speeches (e.g. Howard Richards, 1995 [http://www.howardri.org/nehru.html Nehru Lectures])<ref>see: Anand P. Mavalankar, [[Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda]] ([http://www.howardri.org/Lec-ComAM.html Comment on H.R. Nehru lectures.]).</ref> can be found on [http://www.howardrichards.org/ HR Professor of Peace and Global Studies] (up to 2010), [http://www.howardri.org/Bib.html HR Bibliography], [http://howardrichards.org/ HR website] and the more recent [http://unboundedorganization.org/cgi-sys/suspendedpage.cgi Unbounded Organization] webpage.
== Personal life == Richards married [http://www.biblio.com/sweet-country-by-richards-caroline/work/378047 Caroline Higgins] in July 1965. They have two daughters.

Critica al paradigma dominante - Towards other Economies - Critique of the dominant Paradigm|publisher =[[LOM Ediciones]], Chile|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|url= https://books.google.com/books/about/Rethinking_Thinking.html?id=dcZVmwEACAAJ&redir_esc=y|last1 = Hoppers|first1= Catherine|last2=Richards|first2=Howard|year=2012|title=Rethinking Thinking|publisher=University of South Africa|isbn=1868886891|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|url= http://pegasus.library.ucsb.edu/F/2DFTTPVBTRCSFCYPF9V8MJX2TU76MRUJP61UBRAMR5P2X27MHB-32856?func=short-jump&jump=000021| last=Richards|first=Howard|year=1963| title= An essay on some aspects of Jean-Paul Sartre's concept of nothingness|publisher=University of California Santa Barbara Main Library|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|url= https://books.google.com/books?id=PBFAAAAAIAAJ&q=inauthor:%22Howard+Richards%22&dq=inauthor:%22Howard+Richards%22&hl=en&ei=56IaTeu7KoG4sAOh77WnCg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&redir_esc=y| last=Richards|first=Howard| year = 1966|title= Life on a Small Planet: a Philosophy of Value |publisher=Philosophical Library, New York|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|url=http://philpapers.org/rec/RICDJ|last=Richards|first=Howard| title= Distributive Justice – PhD Dissertation Santa Barbara|year=1974|publisher=Center for Digital Philosophy|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|url= http://biblioteca.uahurtado.cl/ujah/reduc/pdf/pdf/2969.pdf|last = Richards|first= Howard|year=1982|title = La Evaluacion de la Accion Cultural. Estudio Evaluativo del P.P.H.|publisher = CIDE, Santiago, Chile|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|last=Richards|first=Howard|year=1984|url= http://www.ebooks4free.us/188/book9780333363386.htm|title= The Evaluation of Cultural Action - An Evaluative Study of the Parents and Children Program|publisher=Palgrave Macmillan|isbn=0333363388|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|last=Richards|first=Howard|year=1994 |url = http://www.boomerangbooks.com.au/Letters-from-Quebec/Howard-Richards/book_9781883255176.htm|title= Letters from Quebec: A Philosophy for Peace and Justice: Volumes I and II.|publisher=Boomerang books|isbn=9781883255176 |ref=harv}} * {{cite book|last=Richards|first=Howard|year=2004|url=https://books.google.com/books?hl=es&lr=&id=9Kw5vLbYq-4C&oi=fnd&pg=PR3&dq=%22Howard+Richards%22&ots=b12vNTvKgy&sig=nWsQE5iLo772uDcWhgYmxmWzvUo&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22Howard%20Richards%22&f=false |title= Understanding the Global Economy |publisher=Peace Education Books, Thousand Oaks, CA USA|isbn=0974896101|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|url= https://books.google.com/books?id=c14UNW298sAC&pg=PA46 |last1 = Richards|first1= Howard|last2=Swanger|first2=Joanna|year=2008|title= The Dilemmas of Social Democracies: Overcoming Obstacles to a More Just World|publisher=Lexington Books|isbn= 978-0-7391-2927-2|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|last1=Richards|first1=Howard|last2=Swanger|first2=Joanna|url= http://www.dignitypress.org/dignity-press-books/gandhi-economics|year=2011|title=Gandhi and the Future of Economics|publisher= Dignity Press|isbn=9781937570293|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|last=Richards|first=Howard|year=2012| url= http://www.dignitypress.org/dignity-press-books/the-nurturing-of-time-future |title= The Nurturing of Time Future|publisher=Dignity Press|isbn=9781937570019|ref=harv}} * {{cite book|url= http://unboundedorganization.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/UOfuturesocialism.pdf|last = Richards|first= Howard|year=2013|title= Unbounded organisation and the future of socialism|publisher= Education As Change, Volume 17, No. 2, July 2013, pp. 229-242|ref=harv}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox book | name = In Defense of Global Capitalism | title_orig = Till världskapitalismens försvar | translator = | image = In Defence of Global Capitalism.jpg | caption = Cover of the US version of the book | author = [[Johan Norberg]] | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = [[Sweden]] | language = [[Swedish language|Swedish]] | series = | subject = [[Globalization]], [[capitalism]], [[free trade]] | genre = | publisher = [[Timbro]] (Sweden) | release_date = May 2001 | english_release_date = | media_type = Print (hardcover & paperback) | pages = 277 | isbn = 978-1-930865-47-1 | dewey= 330.12/2 22 | congress= HB501 .N6713 2003 | oclc= 52575540 | preceded_by = | followed_by = [[När människan skapade världen]] }}
'''''In Defense of Global Capitalism''''' (in [[Swedish language|Swedish]]: ''Till världskapitalismens försvar'') is a book by [[Sweden|Swedish]] writer [[Johan Norberg]] promoting [[economic globalization]] and [[free trade]]. The book was originally published in May 2001 by the Swedish think tank [[Timbro]]. Since then, a number of translations into other languages have followed.
In the book, Norberg examines the arguments put forward by the [[anti-globalization movement]]. According to Norberg, "the diffusion of capitalism in the last decades has lowered [[Measuring poverty|poverty rates]] and created opportunities for individuals all over the world. [[Standard of living|Living standards]] and [[life expectancy]] has risen fast in most places. World hunger, [[infant mortality]], and [[Economic inequality|inequality]] have diminished. This is because of economic and technological development that is the result of [[free market]] policies. The poor countries that have [[Liberalization|liberalized]] their economies have shown impressive results, while those that have not are stuck in deep misery. Therefore, we need more capitalism and globalisation if we want a better world, not less".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.johannorberg.net/?page=indefense_about |title=Summary of In Defence of Global Capitalism |accessdate=2008-02-18 |publisher=JohanNorberg.Net}}</ref>
As of 2008, the book has been translated into a dozen of languages including: English, German, Dutch, Turkish, Estonian, French, Finnish, Spanish, Chinese, Polish, and Czech.<ref name=lang1>{{cite web |url=http://www.johannorberg.net/?page=indefense_lang |title=Foreign language editions |accessdate=2008-02-18 |publisher=JohanNorberg.Net}}</ref> Additional translations are available in Arabic, Russian and Mongolian.<ref name=lang2>{{cite web |url=http://www.johannorberg.net/?page=news |title=News |accessdate=2008-02-18 |publisher=JohanNorberg.Net}}</ref>
The book was also the basis for the [[Channel 4]] 2003 documentary film ''[[Globalisation is Good]]'', which was presented by Norberg.
== Reviews == [[Nick Gillespie]], editor-in-chief of ''[[Reason (magazine)|Reason]]'', wrote on the book: "A powerful moral and economic case for globalization. Norberg throws rhetorical Molotov cocktails both at left-wing critics who would condemn developing countries to poverty by insisting on First World workplace and environmental standards as a prerequisite for trade and at Western governments whose free market rhetoric is shamefully undercut by draconian tariffs on textiles and agriculture, the two areas in which the developing world can actually compete."<ref>{{cite news |first=Nick |last=Gillespie |authorlink=Nick Gillespie |title=Poor man's hero: controversial writer Johan Norberg champions globalization as the best hope for the developing world |url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m1568/is_7_35/ai_110361468|publisher=[[Reason (magazine)|Reason]] |date=December 2003 |accessdate=2008-02-19}}</ref>
[[Samuel Brittan]] of ''[[Financial Times]]'' wrote: "Giving clear and verifiable sources, he nails one by one the fallacies and selective statistics that are used by the anti-capitalist protesters."<ref>{{cite news |first=Samuel |last=Brittan |authorlink=Samuel Brittan |title=Capitalism, global and local |url=http://www.samuelbrittan.co.uk/text98_p.html |publisher=[[Financial Times]] |date=2001-12-17 |accessdate=2008-02-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080307232209/http://www.samuelbrittan.co.uk/text98_p.html |archivedate=2008-03-07 |df= }}</ref>
[[Anne Applebaum]] of ''[[Washington Post]]'' wrote: "Johan Norberg makes the case that free trade is good for the developing world, good for freedom, good for social progress, even if the dull old Marxists refuse to see it. It can be no accident that not one but two glamorous young pro-capitalists have emerged in Europe over the past year. [Norberg and France's [[Sabine Herold]]] ...the [anti-globalization] movement has in recent years provided a cushion for those politicians – European, American, Japanese and developing world alike -- who drag their feet about opening markets. Maybe now, if the young, the hip and the free-thinking start pushing the other way, the ministers in their suits will be forced to listen too".<ref>{{cite news |first=Anne |last=Applebaum |authorlink=Anne Applebaum |title=The New Radical Chic |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A51927-2003Sep9.html |publisher=[[Washington Post]] |date=2003-09-10 |accessdate=2008-02-19}}</ref>
[[Ben Stein]], former speechwriter for U.S. Presidents [[Richard Nixon]] and [[Gerald Ford]], wrote: "Johan Norberg's book is a stunningly insightful, brilliantly detailed refutation of the crank theories of the anti-globalists. ''In Defense of Global Capitalism'' is a shining example of what a gifted mind can do working with the truth to advance the cause of capitalism, which in the end is the cause of every decent man and woman".<ref name=reviews>{{cite web |url=http://www.johannorberg.net/?page=indefense_rev |title=Reviewers' opinions |accessdate=2008-02-18 |publisher=JohanNorberg.Net}}</ref>
William H. Peterson of ''[[Washington Times]]'' wrote: "I hail him [Norberg] for making his case for globalization with solid facts, statistics, bar-charts, and lots of flesh-and-blood examples drawn from his travels."<ref name=reviews/>
Dave O'Brien of ''[[Winnipeg Free Press]]'' called Norberg "Europe's answer to our own [[Naomi Klein]]"<ref name=reviews/> and Jacqueline Thorpe of the Canadian ''[[National Post]]'' wrote: "It is a sweet irony that the task of defending global capitalism from the likes of Canada´s own Naomi 'No Logo' Klein has fallen on the shoulders of a pony-tailed Swede who started out as an anarchist obsessed with goth music and black clothes. But it is a role Johan Norberg, author of In Defence of Global Capitalism and at 30, every bit as good-looking as left-wing pin-up Ms Klein, has easily morphed into. ...His book, which won the Antony Fisher Memorial Award in 2002, counters anti-globalization arguments with facts, figures, but mostly common sense".<ref name=reviews/>
Former chairman of the [[National Bank of Poland]] [[Leszek Balcerowicz]] wrote: "The liberal cause has obtained a powerful communicator, Mr Johan Norberg from Sweden. He combines mastery of facts and a deep understanding of theories, with the gift of lucid and emotionally moving argumentation."<ref>{{cite web |first=Leszek |last=Balcerowicz |authorlink=Leszek Balcerowicz |url=http://www.hayek-stiftung.de/fileadmin/user_upload/Preisverleihungen/2003/balcerowicz.pdf |title=Laudatio in honour of the recipients of Friedrich Hayek Prize, 2003 |date=2003-10-12 |accessdate=2008-02-18 |publisher=[[Friedrich-August-von-Hayek-Stiftung]] |format=[[PDF]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080227231630/http://www.hayek-stiftung.de/fileadmin/user_upload/Preisverleihungen/2003/balcerowicz.pdf |archivedate=2008-02-27 |df= }}</ref>
Swedish Professor of Philosophy and socialist [[Torbjörn Tännsjö]] wrote: "Johan Norberg has written an agreeable book in defence of capitalism and globalisation... Even in labour movement discussion circles I think it would repay close study".<ref>{{cite news |first=Torbjörn |last=Tännsjö |authorlink=Torbjörn Tännsjö |title=Ett sympatiskt försvar för världskapitalismen |url=http://lotidningen.lo.se/?id_site=8&id_category=336&id_item=14237&criteria=johan%20norberg |publisher=[[LO-Tidningen]] |date=2001-09-28 |accessdate=2008-02-19 |language=Swedish}}</ref>
== Awards == {| class="wikitable" ! Year ! Award ! Awarded by ! Ref |- | 2002 | Sir Antony Fisher International Memorial Award | [[Atlas Economic Research Foundation]] | <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.atlasusa.org/V2/main/page.php?page_id=33 |title=Winners of the 2002 Fisher Awards |accessdate=2008-02-18 |publisher=[[Atlas Economic Research Foundation]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071124052330/http://www.atlasusa.org/V2/main/page.php?page_id=33 |archivedate=2007-11-24 |df= }}</ref> |- | 2003 | Publizistikpreis der Friedrich-August-von-Hayek-Stiftung | [[Friedrich-August-von-Hayek-Stiftung]] | <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hayek-stiftung.de/119.html?&L=1 |title=Presentation of prizes > 2003 |accessdate=2008-02-18 |publisher=[[Friedrich-August-von-Hayek-Stiftung]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070822032725/http://www.hayek-stiftung.de/119.html?&L=1 |archivedate=2007-08-22 |df= }}</ref> |}

{{primary sources|date=June 2010}}
The '''Independent Online Booksellers Association''' ('''IOBA''') is a trade association of independent used and rare [[bookselling|booksellers]] who sell online.
==History== IOBA was founded in 1999 by a group of independent booksellers to address the opportunities and challenges of the emerging online book selling market. Its purpose is to promote [[internet]] [[bookselling]] and foster the interests of internet booksellers. On August 22, 2002, IOBA was [[incorporation (business)|incorporated]] in the state of [[Delaware]] as a [[non-profit organization]].<ref>{{Cite web |last= |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Division of Corporations - Online Services: General Information Name Search |work= |publisher=State of Delaware, Department of State, Division of Corporations |date= |url=https://delecorp.delaware.gov/tin/GINameSearch.jsp |format=requires entry of name: Independent Online Booksellers Association or File Number: 3560613 |doi= |accessdate=July 4, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100106214416/https://delecorp.delaware.gov/tin/GINameSearch.jsp |archivedate=January 6, 2010 |df= }}</ref>
==Membership== IOBA has over 300 members internationally.<ref>{{Cite news | last = Publishers Weekly Staff | title = IOBA Takes on Amazon in Europe | newspaper = [[Publishers Weekly]] | date = June 7, 2010 | url = http://www.publishersweekly.com/pw/by-topic/digital/retailing/article/43427-ioba-takes-on-amazon-in-europe.html | accessdate = Jun 13, 2010}} </ref> Its members sell books through venues including [[Brick and mortar business|brick and mortar]] stores, their own [[website]]s, book fairs, and online bookselling services, but all members have some or all of their stock available online.
To join, an applicant must have online bookselling experience, a minimum number of books listed, a business license as required by their place of residence, and book descriptions and condition statements presented in terms recognized by the bookselling profession.<ref>{{Cite web | title = New Member Application (Professional Membership) | publisher = IOBA | url = http://www.ioba.org/app.html | accessdate = June 13, 2010}} </ref> In addition, the applicant must abide by IOBA's Code of Ethics,<ref>{{Cite web | title = Code of Ethics | publisher = IOBA | url = http://www.ioba.org/code.html | accessdate = June 13, 2010}} </ref> which spells out professional standards and return policies.
Applicants who do not meet membership requirements may be eligible for the IOBA Mentorship Program, which matches a professional member with the applicant for one-on-one assistance in developing the applicant's business to meet IOBA standards.<ref>{{Cite web | title = IOBA Mentorship Program | publisher = IOBA | url = http://www.ioba.org/mentorship.html | accessdate = June 33, 2010}}</ref>
==Governance== IOBA operates under a set of bylaws and is governed by a board of directors elected by the membership. The Board of Directors consists of a four-person Executive Committee and six At-Large Representatives. The Executive Committee is composed of the officers, who are each elected for a one-year term: [[President (corporate title)|President]], [[Vice-President]], [[Secretary (club)|Secretary]] and [[Treasurer]]. The six At-Large Representatives each serve a three-year term with staggered election dates so that two are elected each year.
Standing committees further the work of IOBA: Membership, Bylaws, Finance, Internet Operations, and Public Relations. The Chairs of these committees are appointed by the President, and are [[Ex officio member|ex-officio]], non-voting board members.<ref>{{Cite web | title = Bylaws of the Independent Online Booksellers Association | publisher = IOBA | url = http://www.ioba.org/bylaw1.html | accessdate = June 23, 2010}}</ref>
==Mission== See<ref>{{Cite web | title = Independent Online Booksellers Association - Mission Statement | publisher = IOBA | date = (c) 1999 to present | url = http://www.ioba.org/mission.html | accessdate = June 19, 2010}} </ref> which states:
The Independent Online Booksellers Association promotes independent online bookselling by: * Maintaining high professional standards among the membership, backed up by a Code of Ethics. * Furthering bookseller professional development through the establishment of a Mentorship Program, the granting of scholarships, and the publication of an online journal the IOBA Standard. * Promoting trust between customers and booksellers by providing a safe online environment for the sale and purchase of books. * Fostering consumer awareness of online book buying. * Interacting with businesses, organizations, and governmental entities that affect online bookselling. * Providing programs and services that will help member booksellers to strengthen their businesses.
===Professional standards=== The IOBA provides resources to booksellers and the general public that promote professionalism and transparency in book descriptions and the selling process.<ref>{{cite web|last=Gibson|first=Greg|title=The Naval Chronicle|url=http://bookmanslog.blogspot.com/2011/03/naval-chronicle-complete-in-40-volumes.html|work=Bookman's Log|publisher=Bookman's Log|accessdate=April 2, 2011}}</ref> These include a Code of Ethics to which members are required to adhere, guidelines for book condition descriptions, definitions of book-related terms and abbreviations, and an annotated list of reference works useful to booksellers and book buyers.
===Professional development=== IOBA supports professional education for booksellers, and offers an annual scholarship contest. The 2010 contest offered two full-tuition scholarships with a stipend for travel expenses.<ref>{{Cite web | title = Annual IOBA Scholarship Contest | publisher = IOBA | year = 2010 | url = http://www.ioba.org/private/contest.pdf | format = PDF | accessdate = June 19, 2010}} </ref> One of these scholarships was reserved for the Colorado Antiquarian Book Seminar (CABS).<ref>{{Cite web | title = Scholarships for the Colorado Antiquarian Book Seminar | publisher = Colorado Antiquarian Book Seminar | date = (c)2010 | url = http://www.bookseminars.com/scholarships.php#8 | accessdate = June 19, 2010}}</ref> The other scholarship could be used at CABS, the [[Rare Book School]] (RBS), the California Rare Book School (CalRBS) or the London Rare Book School.
IOBA publishes an online magazine called ''The Standard'',<ref>{{Cite web | title = The Standard | publisher = IOBA | url = http://www.ioba.org/newsletter/archive.html | accessdate = June 19, 2010}} </ref> with articles pertinent to the bookselling trade and to collectors. It is primarily written by the membership to share their experiences and expertise, but it is available to the general public.
===Customer Trust=== IOBA reassures customers with a Book Buyer's Bill of Rights<ref>{{Cite web | title = Book Buyers Bill of Rights | publisher = IOBA | date = (c)1999-present | url = http://www.ioba.org/bor.html | accessdate = June 19, 2010}} </ref> that guarantees accurate descriptions, reasonable shipping costs, and a satisfaction guaranteed return policy.
===Related organizations=== IOBA monitors organizations that affect online bookselling and sends alerts to its own members, or writes letters on behalf of the IOBA membership. For example, in December 2009, IOBA issued a warning advisory to members about changing description standards on Half.com that could jeopardize a sellers Half.com and eBay accounts.<ref>{{Cite web | last = | first = | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Breaking Bookselling News from BookThink.com | work = | publisher = Bookthink.com | date = Archive for December 2009 | url = http://bookthink.com/wordpress/?m=200912 | format = | doi = | accessdate = July 4, 2010}}</ref> In early 2010, IOBA sent an official letter to authorities in the United Kingdom (including the UK's OFT), France, Germany and the European Union, protesting at Amazon "Price Parity Policy" labeling it "dangerously anti‐competitive".<ref>{{Cite web | last = Jones | first = Phillip | title = Online booksellers protest at Amazon 'price parity' move | publisher = TheBookseller.com | date = March 6, 2010 | url = http://www.thebookseller.com/news/120048-page.html | accessdate = June 19, 2010}} </ref><ref>{{Cite web | last = Lieberman | first = Michael | title = Amazon's Next Price War? | publisher = seattlepi.com reader blog | date = June 2010 | url = http://blog.seattlepi.com/bookpatrol/archives/209286.asp | accessdate = June 2010}} </ref>
==See also== *[[Independent bookstore]] *[[List of booksellers associations]]

Routledge, 2006. * Tedford, Marie and Goudey, Pat "The Official Price Guide to Collecting Books, 6th Edition". House of Collectibles, 2008. * Mould, Michael E. "Online Bookselling: A Practical Guide with Detailed Explanations and Insightful Tips". Lulu, 2006. * Windwalker, Stephen "Buying Books Online: Finding Bargains and Saving Money at Booksense Stores, Amazon's Marketplace, and Other Online Sites". Harvard Perspectives Press, 2002.

The '''Industry Classification Benchmark''' (ICB) is an [[industry classification]] [[Taxonomy (general)|taxonomy]] launched by [[Dow Jones and Company|Dow Jones]] and [[FTSE Group|FTSE]] in 2005 and now owned solely by FTSE International. It is used to segregate markets into [[List of recognized economic sectors|sectors]] within the [[macroeconomy]]. The ICB uses a system of 10 industries, partitioned into 19 supersectors, which are further divided into 41 sectors, which then contain 114 subsectors.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.icbenchmark.com|title=Industry Classification Benchmark (ICB)|author=|date=21 June 2017|website=icbenchmark.com}}</ref><ref>[http://www.icbenchmark.com/ICBDocs/ICB_%20Product_Spec_Nov2011.pdf Industry Classification Benchmark structure] (pdf)</ref>
The ICB is used globally (though not universally) to divide the market into increasingly specific categories, allowing investors to compare industry trends between well-defined subsectors. The ICB replaced the legacy [[FTSE Group|FTSE]] and [[Dow Jones and Company|Dow Jones]] classification systems on 3 January 2006, and is used today by the [[NASDAQ]], NYSE and several other markets around the globe. All ICB sectors are represented on the [[New York Stock Exchange]] except Equity Investment Instruments (8980) and Nonequity Investment Instruments (8990).<ref>https://www.nyse.com/indexes/nyaindex.csv</ref>
Dow Jones divested itself of its 50% interest in the ICB in 2011 and announced it was creating its own version of it.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://press.djindexes.com/index.php/dow-jones-indexes-divests-its-50-interest-in-industry-classification-benchmark-2/|title=Dow Jones Indexes Divests Its 50% Interest in Industry Classification Benchmark|publisher=Dow Jones Indexes|format=press release|date=16 June 2011}}</ref>

[[Category:Industry classifications]] [[Category:Financial markets]]

[[Valuation (finance)|Valuation]] is considered as one of the most critical areas in [[finance]]; it plays a key role in many areas of [[finance]] such as buy/sell, [[solvency]], [[merger]] and [[Takeover|acquisition]].
==Rationale== There are numerous individual reasons or motivations for conducting an intellectual property valuation or economic [[Economic appraisal|appraisal]] analysis. A valuation is prepared, for example, for [[Financial transaction|transactions]], [[pricing]] and strategic purposes, [[financing]] [[securitization]] and [[collateralization]], [[tax]] planning and [[compliance (regulation)|compliance]], and litigation support.
==Factors driving the value of intellectual property==
Intellectual property derives its value from a wide range of significant parameters such as [[market share]], [[barriers to entry]], legal protection, IP’s profitability, [[Industry|industrial]] and [[economic]] factors, growth projections, remaining economic life, and new [[technologies]].
== Approaches== {{Unreferenced section|date=November 2008}} The valuation process necessitates gathering much more information as well as in-depth understanding of [[economy]], [[industry]], and specific business that directly affect the value of the [[intellectual property]]. Therefore, such information may be gathered from external and / or internal sources. Finally, the information is devoted to be turned into financial models to estimate the fundamental value of a particular type of intellectual property based on such adapted International Valuation Standards.
* [[Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practice]] (USPAP) * [[International Valuation Standards Committee]] (IVSC) (50 Countries) * [[US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles]] (GAAP) * [[International Financial Reporting Standards]] (IFRS) * [[Financial Accounting Standards Board]] (FASB)
The valuation analysts use numerous approaches in order to reach a reasonable indication of a defined value for the subject intangible assets on a certain date which is referred to as the valuation date. The most common approaches to estimate the fundamental or fair value of the intellectual property are defined as the following:
1. '''Cost approach:''' The [[cost]] approach is based on the economic principle of [[substitution (economics)|substitution]]. This principle states that an [[investor]] will pay no more for an asset than the cost to obtain, by [[purchasing]] or constructing, a substitute asset of equal utility. There are several cost approach valuation methods, the most common being the historical cost, replacement cost, and replication cost.
2.''' Market approach:''' The [[Market (economics)|market]] approach is based on the [[economic]] principle of [[competition]] and [[Economic equilibrium|equilibrium]]. These principles conclude that, in a free and unrestricted [[Market (economics)|market]], [[supply and demand]] factors will drive the [[price]] of an asset at equilibrium point. Furthermore, it provides an indication of the value by comparing the price at which similar property has exchanged between willing buyers and sellers. Data on such similar transactions may be accessed in several public sources, including specialized royalty rate databases.{{cn|date=October 2014}}
3. '''Income approach:''' This approach estimates the fair value of intellectual property by discounting the future economic benefits of ownership at an appropriate discount rate.
4. '''Direct approach:''' The direct approach is based on the current value of shares of [[intellectual property]] in an Intellectual Property (IP) Share Market.<ref name="test">[http://www.the-scientist.com/?articles.view/articleNo/27084/title/Time-for-an-IP-Share-Market-/ 'Lyons-Weiler, J. 2009.', '''The Scientist'''], ''Time for an IP Share Market?''.</ref>
5. Using the pay-off method on top of the four above mentioned methods is a way to enhance the valuation and analysis of intellectual property <ref>[http://nopr.niscair.res.in/bitstream/123456789/12687/1/JIPR%2016%285%29%20377-384.pdf Collan, M. and Heikkilä, M., 2011, Enhancing Patent Valuation with the Pay-Off Method, Journal of Intellectual Property Rights, 16, 5, 377-384]</ref>
==See also== *[[Economics and patents]] * [[Patent valuation]] *[[International Valuation Standards Committee]] *[[Patent portfolio]] *[[Tax amortization benefit]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.wipo.int/sme/en/documents/valuationdocs/index.htm List of intellectual property valuation articles compiled by the World Intellectual Property Organisation] * [http://nopr.niscair.res.in/handle/123456789/12687 Patent valuation with the pay-off method, downloadable article]

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/172.58.225.39|172.58.225.39]] ([[User talk:172.58.225.39|talk]]): unexplained content removal ([[WP:HG|HG]]) (3.4.4)
revision.text:
A '''letter of recommendation''' or '''recommendation letter''', also known as a '''letter of reference''', '''reference letter''' or simply '''reference''', is a document in which the writer assesses the qualities, characteristics, and capabilities of the person being recommended in terms of that individual's ability to perform a particular task or function. Letters of recommendation are typically related to [[employment]] (such a letter may also be called an '''employment reference''' or '''job reference'''), [[University and college admission|admission to institutions of higher education]], or [[scholarship]] eligibility. Recommendation letters are usually specifically requested to be written about someone, and are therefore addressed to a particular requester (such as a new employer, university admissions officer, etc.), although they may also be issued to the person being recommended without specifying an addressee.
References may also be required of companies seeking to win contracts, particularly in the fields of engineering, consultancy, industry and construction, and with regard to [[public procurement]] and [[tender offer|tenders]]. Reference letters for organizations are used to assess its ability to deliver the required level of service.
Some applications, such as professional schools give applicants the choice to waive their right to view their letters or not. Usually, applicants are encouraged to waive their rights because if they do not, it is a sign they are not confident in their recommenders.
== Referee ==
The person providing a reference is called a '''referee'''. An employment reference letter is usually written by a former employer or manager, but references can also be requested from co-workers, customers and vendors.<ref name=Doyle>{{cite web|last=Doyle|first=Alison|title=References for employment|url=http://jobsearch.about.com/od/referencesrecommendations/a/referencetips.htm|accessdate=2 May 2012}}</ref> Teachers and professors often supply references for students who have taken their classes.<ref>{{cite web|title=Requesting Letters of Recommendation|url=http://web.csulb.edu/~psy301/lettersrec.html|website=PSY 301|publisher=California State University Long Beach|accessdate=5 April 2017}}</ref> Reference letters for organizations are usually supplied by parties to which the company has provided similar services in the past.
== Content == The employment reference letter can cover topics such as:<ref>Peter Häusermann: ''Arbeitszeugnisse – wahr, klar und fair. Tipps und Anregungen für verantwortungsbewusste Arbeitgeber''. 6. Auflage. Spektramedia, Zürich 2008, {{ISBN|978-3-908244-08-0}}</ref> * the employee's tasks and responsibilities * the duration of employment or tasks/ responsibilities * the position relative to the author of the reference letter * the employee's abilities, knowledge, creativity, intelligence * the employee's qualifications (foreign languages, special skills) * the employee's social attitude * the employee's power of rapport * reason(s) of employment termination * some text with the actual recommendation itself (e.g. 'I unequivocally recommend ... [name] as a ... [function/ role] and would be happy to hire him/ her again').
== Language == In some countries, elements of performance are evaluated using established forms of expression, sometimes [[euphemism|euphemistic]]. For example, in the German-language ''Arbeitszeugnis'', the following terms are frequently used:<ref>Günter Huber, Waltraud Müller: ''Das Arbeitszeugnis in Recht und Praxis. Rechtliche Grundlagen, Musterzeugnisse, Textbausteine, Zeugnisanalyse''. 12. Auflage. Haufe, Freiburg/Breisgau, Berlin, Planegg bei München, Würzburg 2009, {{ISBN|978-3-448-09322-3}}</ref> * Excellent = ''stets zu unserer vollsten Zufriedenheit erledigt'' (always done to our complete satisfaction) * Good = ''stets zu unserer vollen Zufriedenheit'' (always to our full satisfaction) * Satisfactory = ''zu unserer vollen Zufriedenheit'' (to our full satisfaction) * Adequate = ''zu unserer Zufriedenheit'' (to our satisfaction) * Poor = ''hat sich bemüht, den Anforderungen gerecht zu werden'' (has endeavored to meet the demands)
This language established itself as an unwritten code in the employment world. Its purpose was to give even weakly performing employees a letter of recommendation that does not sound negative. However, the euphemistically glazed-over descriptions are now codified and generally known, so that the original cryptic intent is no longer served. <ref>Thorsten Knobbe, Mario Leis, Karsten Umnuß: ''Arbeitszeugnisse: Textbausteine und Tätigkeitsbeschreibungen'' (dt./engl.). 5. Auflage. Haufe, Freiburg/Breisgau, Berlin, Planegg bei München, Würzburg 2010, {{ISBN|978-3-448-10118-8}}.</ref> Nonetheless, it is still standard to use this codified language.
== Checking of references == Most potential employers will contact referees to obtain references before offering a job to a new employee. A survey by the [[Society for Human Resource Management]] (SHRM) found that eight out of ten resource professionals said they regularly conduct reference checks for professional (89%), executive (85%), administrative (84%) and technical (81%) positions.<ref>{{cite web|last=Doyle|first=Alison|title=References - Will They or Won't They?|url=http://jobsearch.about.com/od/gettingreferences/a/references.htm|accessdate=2 May 2012}}</ref> Candidates are advised to ensure that they provide a suitable list of referees to their new prospective employer or institution, and to contact those referees to ensure that they are able and willing to provide a suitable reference. In some cases employers will contact a candidate's former company for a reference even if no contact is supplied by the candidate.
==Duty to provide a reference==
Some employers may not be willing to provide reference letters because they may be worried about potential lawsuits. In this case, the employer may only provide the job title, dates of employment and salary history for the employee.<ref name=Doyle/> Finland,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tyosuojelu.fi/web/en/employment-relationship/certificate-of-employment|title=Certificate of employment|last=|first=|date=|website=Website of Occupational Safety and Health Administration in Finland|archive-url=|archivedate=|dead-url=|accessdate=13 March 2018}}</ref> [[Germany]], [[Austria]], [[Switzerland]], [[Hungary]]<ref>See [http://njt.hu/cgi_bin/njt_doc.cgi?docid=143164.348578 Section 81 of the Labour Code]</ref> and [[Bulgaria]] are the only countries in [[Europe]] where employees can legally claim an employment reference, including the right to a correct, unambiguous and benevolent appraisal.<ref>Heinz-Günther Dachrodt, Erich Ullmann: ''Zeugnisse lesen und verstehen. Formulierungen und ihre Bedeutung''. [[Österreichischer Gewerkschaftsbund|ÖGB]]-Verlag Wien 2000, {{ISBN|3-7035-0809-4}}</ref>
While there is no [[common law]] duty to provide a reference,<ref>''Lawton v BOC Transhield Ltd'', [1987] 2 All ER 608</ref> the [[Supreme Court of Canada]] has held that a refusal to do so may constitute "conduct that is [[Injustice|unfair]] or is in [[bad faith]]" with respect to a [[wrongful dismissal]], and thus "indicative of the type of conduct that ought to merit compensation by way of an addition to the [[notice period]]."<ref>{{cite CanLII|litigants=Wallace v United Grain Growers Ltd|link=Wallace v United Grain Growers Ltd|year=1997|court=scc|num=332|format=canlii|pinpoint=par. 96-101|parallelcite=[1997] 3 SCR 701|date=1997-10-30|courtname=auto|juris=}}, subsequently affirmed in {{cite CanLII|litigants=Honda Canada Inc v Keays|link=Honda Canada Inc v Keays|year=2008|court=scc|num=39|pinpoint=par. 57|parallelcite=[2008] 2 SCR 362|date=2008-06-27}}</ref> There is a [[duty of care]] to ensure that, where one is provided, it is accurate and fair and not give a misleading impression,<ref name="Eversheds2016">{{cite web |url= http://www.eversheds.com/global/en/what/articles/index.page?ArticleID=en/Employment_and_labour_law/Regulatory_references_are_you_ready|title= Regulatory references: are you ready?|author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= 28 January 2016|website= |publisher= [[Eversheds]]|access-date= 13 February 2016}}</ref> as held by the [[House of Lords]] in ''[[Spring v Guardian Assurance plc]]''.<ref>{{cite BAILII|litigants=Spring v Guardian Assurance plc|link=Spring v Guardian Assurance plc|court=UKHL|year=1994|num=7|parallelcite=[1995] 2 AC 296|date=7 July 1994}}</ref> If an employer goes beyond what a reference should contain, or if it gives inaccurate or misleading information, liability may arise in the areas of [[breach of statutory duty]], [[negligent misstatement]], [[Tort of deceit|deceit]], [[defamation]] or [[malicious falsehood]].<ref name="Eversheds2016"/> It does not matter what form the reference might take.<ref>{{cite BAILII|litigants=Byrnell v British Telecommunications & Anor |link=|court=EWHC|division=QB|year=2009|num=727|para=29, 32|parallelcite=|date=20 February 2009}}</ref>
In the United Kingdom, references received by an employer from another person or organization can be disclosed to the person about whom they are written under the subject access provisions of the [[Data Protection Act 1998]], but certain confidentiality considerations apply as to the identity of the person giving the reference.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://ico.org.uk/media/for-organisations/documents/2775/references_v1_final.pdf|title= Data Protection Good Practice Note: Subject access and employment references |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= 16 November 2005|website= |publisher= [[Information Commissioner's Office]]|access-date= 14 February 2016}}</ref> As a result, together with the duty of care under ''Spring'', many organizations have issued guidance as to [[best practice]] to be undertaken by reference providers.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.stir.ac.uk/media/services/registry/planning/legalcompliance/ReferencesAdvisoryNote.pdf|title= Data Classification: Issuing of Staff and Student References Advisory Note|author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= January 2015|website= stir.ac.uk|publisher= [[University of Stirling]]|access-date= |quote=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.sath.nhs.uk/Library/Documents/HR/Policies/HR70%20Employment%20References%20v1.pdf|title= Human Resources Policy No. HR70: Employment References|author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= December 2010|website= sath.nhs.uk|publisher= [[Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust]]|access-date= |quote=}}</ref>
The duty of care has also been held to apply in non-reference situations, as noted in 2011 in '' McKie v Swindon College''.<ref>{{cite journal |last= Salter|first= Michael|last2= Bryden|first2= Chris|date= 24 June 2011|title= Gone but not forgotten|url= http://www.newlawjournal.co.uk/nlj/content/gone-not-forgotten|journal= [[New Law Journal]]|publisher= |volume= 161|issue= 7471|pages= |doi= }}, discussing {{cite BAILII|litigants=McKie v Swindon College|link=|court=EWHC|division=QB|year=2011|num=469|parallelcite=|date=11 February 2011}}</ref> In another case, the [[Court of Appeal of England and Wales]] has held that "a reference must not give an unfair or misleading impression overall, even if its discrete components are factually correct."<ref>{{cite BAILII|litigants= Bartholomew v London Borough Of Hackney & Anor |link=|court=EWCA|division=Civ|year=1998|num=1604|parallelcite=|date=23 October 1998}}</ref> However, while a reference must be accurate and fair, it is not necessary to report all material facts concerning an individual,<ref>{{cite BAILII|litigants=Cox v Sun Alliance Life Ltd|link=|court=EWCA|division=Civ|year=2001|num=649|parallelcite=|date=9 May 2001}}</ref> but it can be argued that, if an agreed reference arising from a [[settlement agreement]] is misleadingly incomplete, the employer can be sued by a subsequent employer for breaching its duty of care.<ref>{{cite book |last1= Smith|first1= Ian|last2= Baker|first2= Aaron|date= 2015|title= Smith & Wood's Employment Law|edition=12th|url= https://books.google.ca/books?id=rpFcCgAAQBAJ&lpg=PA163&ots=jvZ2eKiOVY&pg=PA163#v=onepage&f=false|location= |publisher= [[Oxford University Press]]|page= 163|isbn=978-0-19-872735-4}}</ref> The [[Employment Appeal Tribunal]], in an [[unfair dismissal]] case, ruled that, in preparing a reference, it was not reasonable to provide details of complaints against an employee of which the employee was not aware.<ref>''TSB Bank Plc v Harris'' [http://www.bailii.org/uk/cases/UKEAT/1999/1145_97_0112.html [1999] UKEAT 1145_97_0112] (1 December 1999)</ref>
The Court of Appeal has further held that, if an employee leaves when an investigation is ongoing but has not been concluded, or where issues arise after an employee leaves that have not been investigated, employers can disclose this information but should do so in a measured and fair way, which will be particularly important if to omit this information would mean providing a misleading reference.<ref>{{cite BAILII|litigants=Jackson v Liverpool City Council |link=|court=EWCA|division=Civ|year=2011|num=1068|parallelcite=|date=15 June 2011}}</ref>
In 2016, the [[Financial Conduct Authority]] and the [[Prudential Regulation Authority (United Kingdom)|Prudential Regulation Authority]] are issuing rules that will require the furnishing of references, before any approval or certification may be given by them, as well as specifying the information that they must contain.<ref name="Eversheds2016"/><ref>{{cite web |url= http://fca.org.uk/news/cp15-31-regulatory-references|title= CP15/31: Strengthening accountability in banking and insurance: regulatory references|author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= 6 October 2015|website= |publisher= [[Financial Conduct Authority]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.bankofengland.co.uk/pra/Pages/publications/cp/2015/cp3615.aspx#|title= Strengthening accountability in banking and insurance: regulatory references - CP36/15|author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= 6 October 2015|website= |publisher= [[Prudential Regulation Authority (United Kingdom)|Prudential Regulation Authority]]}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Character witness]] *[[Dago dazzler]]

BW Bildung und Wissen Verlag, Nürnberg 2008, {{ISBN|978-3-8214-7676-6}}. * Hein Schleßmann: ''Das Arbeitszeugnis. Zeugnisrecht, Zeugnissprache, Bausteine, Muster''. 18. Auflage. Verlag Recht und Wirtschaft, Frankfurt am Main 2007, {{ISBN|978-3-8005-3083-0}}. * Volker Stück: ''Das Arbeitszeugnis''. In: ''Monatsschrift für Deutsches Recht''. 60. Jg., Bd. 2, 2006, S. 791–799. * Arnulf Weuster, Brigitte Scheer: ''Arbeitszeugnisse in Textbausteinen. Rationelle Erstellung, Analyse, Rechtsfragen''. 11. Auflage. Richard Boorberg Verlag, Stuttgart, München, Hannover, Berlin, Weimar, Dresden 2007, {{ISBN|978-3-415-03862-2}}. * {{cite web |url= http://greggowe.com/files/Reference%20Letters.pdf|title= Reference Letters|last1= Gowe|first1= Gregory T.|date= May 2006|website= greggowe.com|publisher= Lawson Lundell LLP|location=Vancouver}}
== External links == {{Commonscat|Employment reference letters}} * [http://www.arbeitszeugnis.de/images/Zeugnisstruktur.pdf arbeitszeugnis.de] – PDF file * [http://www.ra-sehn.de/25,0,arbeitszeugnis,index,0.php Info-Arbeitszeugnis] – Secret language * [http://anwalt-im-netz.de/arbeitsrecht/zeugniscode.html Codes or Language] used in [[:de:Arbeitszeugnis|German reference letters]]

revision.text:
[[File:José Huizar and his family during a Chinatown parade.jpg|[[Jose Huizar]] represents the 14th district|thumb|right|200px]]'''Los Angeles City Council District 14''' is one of the 15 districts of the [[Los Angeles City Council]]. It is a primarily [[Latino]] district in [[Boyle Heights]] and [[Northeast Los Angeles]].<ref>[http://cd14.lacity.org/stellent/groups/electedofficials/@cd14_contributor/documents/contributor_web_content/lacitydv_008155.pdf Official city map of District 10 boundaries]</ref> Council Member [[Jose Huizar]] has represented it since 2005.
==Geography==
===Modern===
District 14 consists of all or part of the neighborhoods of the [[Downtown Los Angeles|Downtown]], [[Boyle Heights, Los Angeles|Boyle Heights]], [[Eagle Rock, Los Angeles|Eagle Rock]], [[El Sereno, Los Angeles|El Sereno]], [[Garvanza, Los Angeles|Garvanza]], [[Glassell Park, Los Angeles|Glassell Park]], [[Lincoln Heights, Los Angeles|Lincoln Heights]], and [[Monterey Hills, Los Angeles|Monterey Hills]].<ref>http://cd14.lacity.org/index.htm</ref> The Boyle Heights and Northeast sections are connected by a narrow strip of land. Huizar maintains field offices in Downtown, Boyle Heights, El Sereno and Eagle Rock.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://cd14.lacity.org/YOUR_TEAM/District_Profile/index.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-03-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100313145833/http://cd14.lacity.org/YOUR_TEAM/District_Profile/index.htm |archivedate=2010-03-13 |df= }}</ref>
===Historic===
A new [[city charter]] effective in 1925 replaced the former "[[Plurality-at-large voting|at large" voting system]] for a nine-member council with a [[Single member constituency|district system]] with a 15-member council. Each district was to be approximately equal in population, based upon the voting in the previous gubernatorial election; thus redistricting was done every four years. (At present, redistricting is done every ten years, based upon the preceding U.S. census results.)<ref name=ShiftToValley>[http://articles.latimes.com/2002/jun/12/local/me-council12 Tina Daunt and Seema Mehta, "Council Districts Drawn to Benefit Valley, Latinos," ''Los Angeles Times,'' June 12, 2002]</ref> The numbering system established in 1925 for City Council districts began with No. 1 in the north of the city, the [[San Fernando Valley]], and ended with No. 15 in the south, the [[Port of Los Angeles|Harbor area]].
District 14 has always represented Eagle Rock and Highland Park. As the city's population increased, it has expanded southward. The rough boundaries or descriptions of the district have been as follows:
'''1925''' The communities of [[Eagle Rock, Los Angeles|Eagle Rock]], [[Highland Park, Los Angeles|Highland Park]] and [[Annandale (Pacific Electric)|Annandale]].<ref>[http://proquest.umi.com/pqdweb?did=394260481&sid=17&Fmt=10&clientId=13322&RQT=309&VName=HNP "First Map Showing City's Council Districts," ''Los Angeles Times,'' January 16, 1925, page A-1] Includes a map.</ref>
'''1928''' Westward extension to Allesandro Street.<ref>[http://proquest.umi.com/pqdweb?did=367533262&sid=18&Fmt=10&clientId=13322&RQT=309&VName=HNP "Council Areas' Lines Changed," ''Los Angeles Times,'' December 29, 1928, page A-1]</ref>
'''1932–33:''' East boundary: [[South Pasadena, California|South Pasadena]] and [[Pasadena, California|Pasadena]]. North: [[Glendale, California|Glendale]]. West: [[Glendale Boulevard]].<ref>[http://proquest.umi.com/pqdweb?did=388506821&sid=18&Fmt=10&clientId=13322&RQT=309&VName=HNP "District Lines Get Approval," ''Los Angeles Times,'' December 24, 1932, page 2]</ref>
'''1935''' Same general area as 1932, with the western boundary at [[Griffith Park]],<ref>[http://proquest.umi.com/pqdweb?did=392763061&sid=16&Fmt=10&clientId=13322&RQT=309&VName=HNP "Do You Know Who Your City Councilman Is?" ''Los Angeles Times,'' March 24, 1935, page 22] Includes a map.</ref> thus including the [[Atwater Village, Los Angeles|Atwater]] area.
'''1940''' Same general area as previously, with the west boundary at [[Glendale Boulevard]].<ref>[http://proquest.umi.com/pqdweb?did=410578151&sid=5&Fmt=10&clientId=13322&RQT=309&VName=HNP "Proposed New Alignment for City Voting Precincts," ''Los Angeles Times,'' November 30, 1940, page A-3] Includes a map.</ref>
'''1955:''' [[Rose Hill Park, Los Angeles|Rose Hill]] [sic] is now included in the district's description.<ref>[http://proquest.umi.com/pqdweb?did=435436872&sid=41&Fmt=10&clientId=13322&RQT=309&VName=HNP "Unusual Setup for Council's Contests," ''Los Angeles Times,'' April 3, 1955, page B-3]</ref>
'''1971''' "The district begins in the [[East Los Angeles, California|East Los Angeles]] Mexican-American [[barrio]]s of [[El Sereno, Los Angeles|El Sereno]] and [[Lincoln Heights, Los Angeles|Lincoln Heights]] extends westward across the [[Pasadena Freeway]] to [[Anglo-American ethnic group|Anglo]] middle-class homes in [[Glassell Park]], [[Highland Park, Los Angeles|Highland Park]], [[Hermon, Los Angeles|Hermon]], and [[Eagle Rock, Los Angeles|Eagle Rock]] through [[Griffith Park]]. Around the western edge of the district is the [[Los Feliz, Los Angeles|Los Feliz District]], with some of the city's more expensive homes."<ref>[http://proquest.umi.com/pqdweb?did=644458222&sid=11&Fmt=10&clientId=13322&RQT=309&VName=HNP Bill Boyarsky, "Snyder Expected to Win Easily," ''Los Angeles Times,'' March 25, 1971, page C-1]</ref>
'''1986''' No longer includes Los Feliz. Southern reach includes [[El Sereno, Los Angeles|El Sereno]], College Avenue, [[Huntington Drive]] and portions of Alhambra Avenue and [[Valley Boulevard]], then across the [[San Bernardino Freeway]] to [[Cesar Chavez Avenue|Brooklyn Avenue]], East [[Beverly Boulevard]], Fourth Street and [[Whittier Boulevard]].<ref>[http://proquest.umi.com/pqdweb?did=1085633952&sid=10&Fmt=10&clientId=13322&RQT=309&VName=HNP "Los Angeles' Realigned Council Districts," ''Los Angeles Times,'' September 21, 1986] Includes a map.</ref>
==Officeholders==
District 14 has been represented by 10 men and no women:
{{div col|colwidth=30em}} # [[Isaac Colton Ash]], 1925–27 # [[William G. Bonelli]], 1927–29 # [[Charles A. Holland]], 1929–31 # [[Edward L. Thrasher]], 1931–43 # [[John C. Holland]], 1943–67 # [[Arthur K. Snyder|Art Snyder]], 1967–85 # [[Richard Alatorre]], 1985–99 # [[Nick Pacheco]], 1999–2003 # [[Antonio Villaraigosa]], 2003–05 # [[José Huizar]], 2005– {{div col end}}
==See also== *[[:Category:Los Angeles City Council districts|Los Angeles City Council districts]] *[[Los Angeles City Council]]
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== * [http://cd14.lacity.org/ Official '''Los Angeles City Council District 14''' website] * [http://navigatela.lacity.org/common/mapgallery/pdf/council_districts/cd14.pdf City of Los Angeles: Map of District 14]
{{Los Angeles City Council}} {{Downtown Los Angeles}} {{Los Angeles Eastside}} {{Los Angeles Government}} {{Los Angeles}}
[[Category:Los Angeles City Council districts]] [[Category:Downtown Los Angeles]] [[Category:Eastside Los Angeles]] [[Category:Northeast Los Angeles]] [[Category:Boyle Heights, Los Angeles]] [[Category:Eagle Rock, Los Angeles]] [[Category:El Sereno, Los Angeles]] [[Category:Glassell Park, Los Angeles]] [[Category:Lincoln Heights, Los Angeles]]
